8.text:
Question 8

Answer: 70

Explanation:  
• The triangle is isosceles, so the missing angle is x (may be shown on the diagram).  
• Angles in a triangle sum to 180° (may be indicated by showing the sum of angles is 180).  

Marks: 3  
• 1 AO1.3a  
• 1 AO2.4a  
• 1 AO3.1b  

Additional Guidance:  
• B1 awarded for each correct element.

12.text:
Question 12

(a) [2 marks]  
• 1 AO2.1a  
• 1 AO2.3b  
• B1 for 4 × 4 dotted squares correct  
• B1 for 4 blocks of 4 black squares correct  

(b) 64 [2 marks]  
• 1 AO1.3a  
• 1 AO2.1a  
• M1 for 8 × 8 or 8² or “8 squared”  

(c) 4n [2 marks]  
• 1 AO1.3a  
• 1 AO2.3a  
• M1 for 4, 8, 12 seen  

(d)  
• Number of blacks is always even (oe) and reason.  
• Number of dots alternates between odd and even (oe) and reason.  
• even + even = even  
• odd + even = odd  

Award B1, B1, B1, B1, B1, B1 (6 marks total), broken down as:  
• 2 AO2.2  
• 4 AO2.4b  

Accept “4 times table” or “4 is even.”  
Accept any reason that has explanatory value (for example, “odd² = odd”).  

If 0 scored, instead award:  
• B1 for showing it is true for patterns 1, 2, and 3.  
• B1 for showing it is true for at least two more patterns.

15.text:
Correct answer (with correct working):  
25, 30, 17  
Total marks: 5  
(2 AO1.3a, 2 AO3.1d, 1 AO3.3)  

Marking guidelines:

• M1 for x − 8 + x + x + 5 = 72  
• M1FT for 3x – 3 = 72  
• M1FT for 3x = 75 (implied by x = 25)  

AND  

• M1 for substituting their 25 into x – 8 and x + 5  

Alternative method using trials:

• M3 for a correctly evaluated trial of x − 8 + x + x + 5 with x = 25  
  OR M2 for at least two complete correct evaluations of x − 8 + x + x + 5  
  OR M1 for at least one complete correct evaluation of x − 8 + x + x + 5  

AND  

• M1 for substituting their 25 into x – 8 and x + 5  

If 0 or 1 scored, instead award SC2 for 25, 30, 17 with no working or insufficient working.  

If 0 scored, instead award SC1 for x = 25 with no working or insufficient working.  

“Correct working” requires evidence of at least M1M1M1 or M3.  

Methods shown use Kieran as x; apply similar schemes if using Jermaine or Chris as the subject.  

Note: x = 25 scores M1M1M1 if there is some supporting work, but on its own scores SC1.

18.text:
18

Answer (correct answer):  
• Average speed = Distance / Time = 5x km/h  
• 21000 = (60 × 5x) m/s  
• 1000 = 18000x m/s (oe)  
• = 18x m/s  

(4 marks in total: 2 AO1.3a, 2 AO2.2)

Marking guidelines:  
• B1 for x km = 1000 × x m  
• B1 for 5 hours = 60² × 5 s  
• B1 for working to the given answer without an intermediate expression or statement of formula

19.text:
19  25 with correct working  (5 marks)  
2 AO1.3b  
3 AO3.1d  

M1 for 2/5 × 10 = 4 litres red  
   or for 3/5 × 10 = 6 litres white  

M1 for red costs £8 per litre  
   or for white costs £0.50 per litre  

M1 for cost of one 10-litre can is (their 4 × their 8) + (their 6 × their 0.5)  

M1 for 60 – their 35  

If 0 or 1 scored, instead award SC2 for answer 25 with no working or insufficient working  

“Correct working” requires evidence of at least M1M1  

Alternative method:  
M1 for 2 : 3 = 20 litres red : 30 litres white  
M1 for 2 × £80 + 3 × £5 = £175  
M1 for 175 – their 35  
M1 for 60 – their 35
